Article.ArticleTitle: [Application value of motor unit number index in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis].

Abstract.AbstractText: Objective: To investigate the application value of motor unit number index (MUNIX) for diagnosis and assessment progress in patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Method: Sixty healthy controls and 60 ALS patients in the clinic were enrolled from May 2017 to December 2018. The bilateral deltoid, abductor digiti minimi, quadriceps femoris and tibialis anterior muscles of the subjects were detected by MUNIX method, and the negative peak amplitude of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) of ulnar nerve, femoral nerve, peroneal nerve, axillary nerve in bilateral was collected. MUNIX and motor unit size index (MUSIX) of muscles were compared between ALS group and control group. The difference between the MUNIX abnormal rate of muscles and abnormal rate of the corresponding CMAP negative peak amplitude in ALS patients was further compared. Meanwhile, the correlation between the disease course of ALS patients and MUNIX and MUSIX was analyzed. Results: Compared with the control group, the MUNIX values of the deltoid, abductor digiti minimi, quadriceps femoris and tibialis anterior decreased significantly (97±24 vs 183±38, 48±17 vs 191±39, 54±15 vs 159±22, 49±16 vs 147±25, all P<0.05). MUSIX values increased ((175±32) μV vs (47±15) μV, (189±34) μV vs (54±16) μV, (170±30) μV vs (49±13) μV, (190± 36) μV vs (48± 14) μV, all P<0.05)). In ALS patients, the abnormal rate of MUNIX was respectively 81%, 87%, 75% and 89%. The negative peak amplitude abnormal rate of corresponding neuralCMAP was 35%, 40%, 31% and 36%, respectively, with a significant difference (P<0.05). There was a negative correlation between MUNIX value and the course of disease in ALS patients (P<0.05), and a positive correlation between MUSIX value and the course of disease (P<0.05). Conclusion: The MUNIX technique exhibits the features of quantifying the proximal upper and lower limb muscles and assessing the loss of motor units in motor neuron degeneration.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Department of neurology, Peking University Third Hospital, Beijing 100191, China.

Grant.Agency: Peking University Medical Department. -Ulm University Joint Project Foundation

OtherAbstract.AbstractText: 目的： 使用运动单位数量指数（MUNIX）这一电生理技术，研究其在肌萎缩侧索硬化（ALS）患者诊断和评估病情进展中的应用价值。 方法： 收集2017年5月至2018年12月门诊60名健康对照者及60例ALS患者，分别对受试者双侧三角肌、小指展肌、股四头肌、胫前肌进行MUNIX方法检测，采集双侧腋神经、尺神经、股神经、腓神经最大复合肌肉动作电位（CMAP）负峰波幅。比较ALS组和对照组所测肌肉MUNIX、运动单位大小指数（MUSIX）的差异；比较ALS组患者所测肌肉MUNIX异常率与相应神经CMAP负峰波幅异常率的差异；同时，对ALS组患者病程与MUNIX、MUSIX的相关性进行分析。 结果： 与对照组比较，ALS组患者三角肌、小指展肌、股四头肌、胫前肌的MUNIX数值显著下降（分别为97±24比183±38、48±17比191±39、54±15比159±22、49±16比147±25，均P<0.05）；MUSIX数值显著增大（分别为175 μV±32 μV比47 μV±1 5μⅤ、189 μV±34 μV比54 μV±16 μⅤ、170 μV±30 μV比49 μV±13 μⅤ、190 μV±36 μV比48 μV±14 μV，均P<0.05）。ALS患者所测MUNIX数值异常率分别为81%、87%、75%、89%，而相对应神经CMAP波幅异常率分别为35%、40%、31%、36%，有显著性差异（P<0.05）。ALS组患者MUNIX数值与病程呈负相关（P<0.05），MUSIX数值与病程呈正相关（P<0.05）。 结论： MUNIX技术能够定量上肢近端及下肢肌肉的运动单位计数，并能评估运动神经元变性疾病的运动单位的丢失情况。.
